title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 11, ch. IV, subch. B, pt. 101 - Standards For Financial Risk Transfer Between Insurers And Health Care Providers
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 11, ch. IV, subch. B, pt. 101 - Standards For Financial Risk Transfer Between Insurers And Health Care Providers

State Regulations
§ 101.1 - Purpose
§ 101.2 - Applicability
§ 101.3 - Definitions
§ 101.4 - Requirements for risk transfer, insurer reporting, and superintendent's approval
§ 101.5 - Demonstration of financial responsibility
§ 101.6 - Provider stop loss insurance
§ 101.7 - Filing of evidence of provider stop loss insurance
§ 101.8 - Provider stop loss insurance policy; notice to the superintendent
§ 101.9 - Provisions required in health care provider agreements that transfer financial risk
§ 101.10 - Exemptions

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 11, ch. IV, subch. B, pt. 101

Statutory authority: Insurance Law, §§201, 301, 1102, 1109, arts. 32, 41, 42, 43;Public Health Law, §
4403[1][c]
State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
